thread.title: John Harbaugh shoots down USC rumors: ‘It’s not a consideration’
thread.title_full: John Harbaugh shoots down USC rumors: ‘It’s not a consideration’

author: Jon Meoli The Baltimore Sun (TNS)
title: John Harbaugh shoots down USC rumors: ‘It’s not a consideration’
text:
John Harbaugh shoots down USC rumors: ‘It’s not a consideration’ John Harbaugh shoots down USC rumors: ‘It’s not a consideration’ By Jon Meoli The Baltimore Sun (TNS) Oct 16, 2015 Comments 
Ravens coach John Harbaugh on Friday laughed off a report that he was a leading candidate to be the next football coach at the University of Southern California. 
Harbaugh was asked about a report on “The Dan Patrick Show” that he was “high on USC’s short list” after coach Steve Sarkisian was fired amid personal issues this week. 
When asked whether he’d been contacted by Southern Cal or had any interest in the job, Harbaugh joked that he’s “been on a lot of short lists in my life.” 
Then he gave a firm answer: “No. No. Obviously, no. This is what I’m doing. I love the Ravens, I love being here. It’s not a consideration.” 
The Ravens’ 1-4 start is their worst under Harbaugh, but the Super Bowl-winning coach has little reason to leave, it seems. He has a 73-44 regular season record and has six playoff appearances in seven seasons with the Ravens. 
Harbaugh last coached in college at the University of Indiana in 1997.
